title: 10 takeaways from Patriots’ impressive road win over Buccaneers
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams accounted for 222 yards and three touchdowns in the win over the Buccaneers.
Quarterback Drake Maye threw for 270 yards with two touchdowns and one interception, earning MVP chants in Tampa.
Patriots extended their win streak to seven games with a 28-23 victory, bolstering playoff hopes at an 8-2 record.

title: MBTA Transit Police officer facing drunk driving charge after allegedly crashing into pole
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA officer Jonathan Daveiga, 27, charged with DUI after crashing into a pole at Leverett Circle on Oct. 19.
Daveiga pleaded not guilty to DUI and failing to stop; released on personal recognizance from Boston Municipal Court.
Daveiga placed on modified duty; will return to court Dec. 19; Transit Police notified Massachusetts POST Commission.

title: Allston Car Wash employees still in federal custody after ICE raid
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nine Allston Car Wash employees with work permits remain in federal custody after a November 4 ICE raid.
ICE claims the workers entered the U.S. illegally; one worker was allegedly transferred to Texas against court orders.
Local officials and immigrant rights groups are advocating for the employees, calling the detentions unjust and targeting.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Nikki Glaser hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Comedian Nikki Glaser hosted the November 8 episode of 'SNL', marking the fifth episode of its 51st season.
Musical performances were provided by Sombr, and Pete Davidson made a return to the 'Weekend Update' desk.
Glaser's popularity surged following her standout performance at the 2024 Tom Brady roast and hosting the Golden Globes.

title: Watch: Fraser Minten scores game-sealing goal for Bruins against his former team
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Fraser Minten scores the game-sealing goal in Bruins' 5-3 win against the Maple Leafs in Toronto.
The 21-year-old Minten was traded from Toronto to Boston last season, marking his first return with the Bruins.
The Bruins achieve their sixth consecutive win; coach Marco Sturm praises Minten as 'the best player on the ice.'

title: Bruins legend Zdeno Chara describes ‘surreal’ induction into Hockey Hall of Fame
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Zdeno Chara was inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame in Toronto, receiving his Hall of Fame ring and plaque.
Chara, a former Bruins captain and Stanley Cup champion, shared the event with fellow inductee Joe Thornton.
Chara's accolades include a Norris Trophy, Messier award, and a seven-time All-Star selection.

title: What insiders are predicting for the Red Sox in free agency this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Red Sox have around $25 million available before reaching the first luxury tax threshold for 2026.
Top free agents predicted to interest Boston include Alex Bregman, Kyle Schwarber, and Pete Alonso.
Pitchers Dylan Cease and Framber Valdez are among potential signings, with Cease particularly being prioritized.

title: Review & setlist: John Legend was a legendary pro at MGM Fenway (and he knew it)
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: John Legend performed at MGM Music Hall at Fenway on November 7, 2025, highlighting his debut album Get Lifted.
The concert included a mix of songs from Get Lifted, covers, and medleys showcasing Legend's varied musical journey.
Legend's performance blended elements of R&B, gospel, and pop, supported by a dynamic band and multiple covers.

title: Jaylen Brown seemingly criticizes officiating again following Celtics’ loss to Magic
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown criticized officiating again after the Celtics' 123-110 loss to the Magic on Friday.
Brown expressed frustration with referees after a missed foul call in the Celtics' 105-103 loss to the Jazz on Monday.
Despite criticism, Brown was not fined by the league, which acknowledged the missed foul in the Jazz game report.

title: 5 things to know about Buccaneers ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Buccaneers quarterback Baker Mayfield has led the team to a 6-2 record, showing strong deep throw statistics.
Rookie receiver Emeka Egbuka has 562 yards and five touchdowns, but recent performance dipped after a hamstring injury.
Buccaneers' defense, ranked seventh in DVOA, includes key players like Vita Vea, Jamel Dean, and Antoine Winfield Jr.
